summary: "I don't believe in magic. But I do believe in bones." - Jayred Ice-Veins.
descriptionHtml:
--------------
[Bonesmithing] adds just that; Bonesmithing.
In order to begin Bonesmithing you must obtain the "Biography of Jayred Ice-Veins, Vol. 1", which will grant you the abiltiy "Bonesmith I".
It is located somewhere in the Whiterun Catacombs. Once you have the "Bonesmith I" ability you can create weapons and armor using Bone Meal at any forge. These items can be found under the "Misc." category. If you want to improve your Bonesmithing skills, you must hunt down the "Biography of Jayred Ice-Veins, Vol. 2", which is in the clutches of a creature known as the "Mass of Bones". Its lair is located somewhere inside the Windhelm Hall of The Dead. Beware, it won't go down without a fight!

However, if you wish to smith stronger gear, you must possess both Bonesmith perks... And Earthbone Fragments. Earthbone Fragments can only be obtained from killing a new creature called a "World Wound". These are found on the path to High Hrothgar. But, there are only 3 of these Wounds, so use your Fragments wisely as you won't be able to get more until they respawn.
